m_szDocTitle: You Wouldn't Blindly Buy A Car, So Don't Blindly Buy Your Electricity | CleanTechnica
m_szDocSumamry: Credit: CrazyFast / CC BY-NC-SA We all like to think of ourselves as rational people, but the fact of the matter is that we all make economic decisions that are not rational at all. But many of these decisions are so common or engrained in our way of life that we don’t even realize it. Consider this: would you walk in to an auto dealership and just tell the auto dealer that you want to buy a car (no more details than that) and then buy whatever he wants to sell you?
